column4: Guys I have a huge problem. I tried to install a GDM theme on Hardy and now when I boot the loggin screen doesn't load. It just loads an orange screen and the busy pointer.
anyone have any ideas?
Can you still type in your username and password?
no, it's not loading anything.
Then I have no idea. You have no other way to login?
Nope.
startx is not even loading.
Wow... That's of the wierdness ><
That loads a desktop but when I try to  start the login window deal it says that gdm is not running.
So now I am lost. I would do a fresh install but that would wipe out all my file and I can't have that happen.
Have you tried typing $sudo gdm-setup     in a terminal?
RICE: no, standbye let me try that.
Alright. If it gives you the average gdm settings screen, switch back to a trusted theme and check the other theme's directory.
Okay, thatnks
I think someone else said something about that before, I couldn't find the site that said it. Wouldn't you know it.
Would anyone know how to get an ATI radeon 7000 working in Kubuntu?
it tells me that command cannot be found. Mind you an I am Shell prompt from the recovery menu
Ahmm... >< I don't know what else to try.
frelling weird. Maybe if I try running it from the desktop that startx brings up
Yes, it would then.
PROBABLY
I don't know. I tried something similar and it said that gdm was not running.
now when I run the startx a thing comes up saying "This session is running as as privileged user.
Just means you're running the x session with root privaleges.
